notesStmt.note: Yeḥiel Foah, inscribed with his name on folio 293v: זה החומש עם ההפטרות ותלים משלי איוב וה' מגילות של היקר כמר' יחיאל פואה יצו' אחרי חלוק האחי' ... ה' למען חסדיו יזכהו להגות בו הוא וזרעו וזרע זרעו עד סוף כל הדורות אכיר'. Partially erased Hebrew inscription, folio 294v, with tan oath and the names of five witnesses, dated 251 (1491). Shemu᾿el of Pula (?), inscribed with his name on folio 1v, with a list of his sons (faded ink). Anonymous censorial note is given on folio 294v: Io fra luigi lo uidi del 1599.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch with the Five Scrolls, Psalms, Job and the Hafṭarot, with punctuation and accents.

msItem.title: Torah, megilot ṿe-hafṭarot תורה, מגילות והפטרות

collation.p: 30 quires of 10 leaves, except from the last quire which has 6 leaves extant. Quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages, and marked with catchwords on the last page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 15th century, punctuated and accentuated. Abraham Farissol [of Avignon], son of Mordekhai Farissol, inscribed with his name in colophon, folio 293v.

binding.p: Post-1600. Morocco binding, gold-tooled. Spine: 'Codex Biblicus Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Ex Dono Sol. da Costa. 4709.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Salomon da Costa, inscribed with his name on the upper and lower cover of the binding, in gold letters and ornamental design, dated 1719, London.
